intro: Macrolobium brachystegioides, commonly known as the short-stemmed macrolobium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
